node.title: TGA approves Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for 5-11-year-olds
node.alt: Needles containing the COVID vaccine sit in shallow blue plastic containers ready to be injected.
node.description: The Therapeutic Goods Administration provisionally approves the Pfizer vaccine for children aged between five and 11 years of age.
node.content: ["Australia's Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) has provisionally approved the Pfizer vaccine for children aged between five and 11 years of age.\u00a0", "Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt said the government expected to begin the rollout of the vaccine to the age group from January 10, once it is approved from the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI).", "\"The vaccine dose approved by the TGA for children aged 5 to 11 is the same safe and effective vaccine used for other age cohorts, however is one-third the dose approved for those aged 12 and over,\" he said.", "\"The Pfizer vaccine for 5 to 11-year-olds will be distributed to vaccine providers in different packaging to the vaccine approved for people 12 and over, and will be clearly differentiated by being dispensed from orange-capped vials instead of grey or purple-capped vials.\"", "More to come.\u00a0"]
